body:
Comment 4: 
Considering that the gc compiler supports neither PowerPC nor COFF, an AIX port would be
a substantial amount of work.  I'm not aware of anybody on the core Go team interested
in working on this.  Unless somebody with a lot of time and skill steps forward, I think
support is quite unlikely.

It would be much less work to add AIX support to the gccgo compiler.  I doubt it works
today but I think somebody with some knowledge of the XCOFF object file format could do
the port without too much work.
_Status changed to **LongTerm**._
